But how do I know that my personal information is safe with your company?\n\nSupport Agent: We have various security measures in place, such as firewalls and encryption, to ensure your personal information is protected. Additionally, depending on your product or service, there may be specific regulations that apply.\n\nCustomer: Okay, that makes sense. But what do you mean by \"deceptive\" or \"misleading?\"\n\nAgent: Deceptive advertising may include things like intentionally making false claims or omitting important information about your product or service. Misleading advertising may occur if you make a claim that might be true but leave out important details that alter the overall meaning or effect of that claim.\n\nCustomer: Okay. Can you give me an example?\n\nAgent: Sure. An example of deceptive advertising would be if you claimed that your product could cure a disease, without scientific evidence supporting that claim.
